unnormalised: I was in a real fix a few months ago, needed cash urgently for my sister's wedding. I'd heard horror stories about loan sharks, so that was a no-go. My friend suggested trying online loan apps, which I was initially skeptical about. I mean, giving my Aadhaar no. and PAN details to an app? Sounded risky.
normalised: I was in a real fix a few months ago, needed cash urgently for my sister's wedding. I had heard horror stories about loan sharks, so that was a no-go. My friend suggested trying online loan apps, which I was initially skeptical about. I mean, giving my A-A-D-H-A-A-R number and P-A-N details to an app? Sounded risky.

unnormalised: I downloaded a couple of them, read the fine print (or at least tried to!), and finally settled on one that seemed legit. Applied for a personal loan of ₹50,000. They asked for all sorts of docs - salary slips, bank statements, you name it. The interest rate was around 18% p.a., which felt high, but hey, desperation makes you do things.
normalised: I downloaded a couple of them, read the fine print (or at least tried to!), and finally settled on one that seemed legit. Applied for a personal loan of rupee fifty thousand. They asked for all sorts of docs - salary slips, bank statements, you name it. The interest rate was around eighteen percent p.a., which felt high, but hey, desperation makes you do things.

unnormalised: To my surprise, the loan was approved within 24 hrs. I got a message saying the amount was credited to my account. They also sent me a repayment schedule – EMI of Rs. 4500 for 12 months. It was a relief, honestly. The wedding went off smoothly, and I’m slowly but surely paying off the loan.
normalised: To my surprise, the loan was approved within twenty four hours. I got a message saying the amount was credited to my account. They also sent me a repayment schedule – E-M-I of rupees four thousand five hundred for twelve months. It was a relief, honestly. The wedding went off smoothly, and I am slowly but surely paying off the loan.

unnormalised: But there were a few hiccups. One time, I missed an EMI payment by a day because I was travelling. They started calling me non-stop, even calling my relatives! That was super embarrassing. I paid the EMI + late fee (Rs. 500) immediately, but the experience left a bad taste.
normalised: But there were a few hiccups. One time, I missed an E-M-I payment by a day because I was travelling. They started calling me non-stop, even calling my relatives! That was super embarrassing. I paid the E-M-I plus late fee (rupees five hundred) immediately, but the experience left a bad taste.

unnormalised: So, are online loan apps good or bad? It depends. They can be a lifesaver in emergencies, but be super careful. Check the interest rates, read the terms and conditions, and make sure you can actually afford to repay the loan. Otherwise, you might end up in more trouble than you started with. And always, always, protect your personal information.
